meanings.definition: To break down (a compound) by reaction with water.
meanings.sent1: I watched the scientist hydrolyze the sugar cube in the water.
meanings.sent2: The enzymes in our stomach help hydrolyze the food we eat.
meanings.sent3: The rain seemed to hydrolyze the sidewalk, making it softer.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to hydrolyze the tension in the room, calming everyone down.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a special solvent to hydrolyze the paint, creating a unique effect.

meanings.sent1: The chemical compound will hydrolyze when exposed to water.
meanings.sent2: The plastic bottle started to hydrolyze after being left in the sun for too long.
meanings.sent3: The candy bar seemed to hydrolyze in my pocket, turning into a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The old documents began to hydrolyze over time, becoming fragile and yellowed.
meanings.sent5: The metal fence appeared to hydrolyze in the salty sea air, rusting quickly.
